children.value: Guide that contains solutions for problems during installation and after installing macOS on an AMD computer
This guide is made by personal researches and actual fixes found mostly on

contents.title: What in the world is Hackintosh ?
contents.description: A Hackintosh is a computer that runs macOS on computer hardware that is not authorized for the purpose by Apple. Wiki

children.value: What in the world is Hackintosh ?
A Hackintosh is a computer that runs macOS on computer hardware that is not authorized for the purpose by Apple.
, Hackintoshing isn't illegal, but it is breaking the EULA.
Why in the world would someone want that ?
Building a Hackintosh can be significantly cheaper than buying a real Mac.
Users can choose their own hardware, often opting for more powerful parts than those available in real Mac devices.
Some users need macOS for specific software that is not available on Windows or Linux.
Enthusiasts and hobbyists enjoy experimenting with different operating systems and configurations.
Some users simply prefer the macOS environment and its ecosystem but do not want to invest in Apple's hardware.
Setting up a Hackintosh is a technical challenge that can be educational and rewarding for those interested in computer hardware and software.
This guide will be updated with every new thing that I learn/see.

children.value:
andomization) is used for loading the kernel. It's used for security purposes.
KASLR makes it much harder for attackers to figure out where the important objects are in memory as it's always random.
In real Mac devices, all 256 places are open, thus they allow the kernel to be loaded randomly in memory.
But, as we don't have real Mac devices, our memory maps aren't set up in a way that suits the macOS kernel, and in some cases boot.efi cannot be loaded.
This error can be manifested in many ways:

You can bypass this by booting Windows using Windows Boot Manager and not OpenCore, but it's not convinient.
